creator: MakerQueen
title: Create a Computer Game With RPGMaker
materials_required: RPGMaker - game design software available from TheRPGMaker Website.
description: This project guides you through the basics of creating a role-playing game using RPGMaker software. It covers map creation, event creation (transferring maps, adding treasure chests, combat), and playtesting, allowing you to learn game design, character design, and game flow.
steps: Open RPGMaker and start a new project by selecting 'New Project' from the file menu, choosing a name and folder for your game.
Create your first map by using the map icon to add tiles to the game screen. Experiment with different map elements to customize the look and feel.
Create a second map by right-clicking the map in the bottom left screen and selecting 'New Map'. Customize this map as well, utilizing different tilesets.
Add an event to transfer the character to the second map by clicking the 'Event' icon, right-clicking the desired spot, and selecting the 'Transfer to a new location' option.
Select the second map you created as the destination for the transfer.
Choose a location on the new map where the character will appear after the transfer.
Add a treasure chest event using 'Quick Event Creation' to place a chest containing gold, a weapon, or armor. Make it tricky by adding transfer events around it that move the player away.
Add a combat event by right-clicking a square, selecting 'New Event', and then 'Battle Processing'. Choose an enemy and a graphic for the NPC.
Create a portal back to the starting screen using the 'Transfer' quick event to allow easy navigation.
Playtest your game frequently using the 'Playtest' button to ensure everything is working as intended.
